name: isosorbide
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1398
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base has a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The fluorine atom raises the melting point due to strong electronegativity and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carbamate group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl groups increases the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C.
